title: The Elements of Typographic Style
content:
As I haven't yet read Robert Bringhurst's book ' [The Elements of Typographic Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20101127071744/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Elements%20of%20Typographic%20Style)', I would like to ask, which is the latest edition published as of yet?

Thanks!  
T
author: typewiz

comments.content:
The third edition (Version 3.0) came out in 2004: available in hardcover and paperback.

Linda

I doubt there's been any significant content changes since it's release.

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Elements\_of\_Typographic\_Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20101127071744/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Elements_of_Typographic_Style "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Elements\_of\_Typographic\_Style")
Wow, I only have version 2.4; I feel so out of date.
Version 3.1 is out, it's what I have.

Version 3.x has a significant amount of new material over 2.x, including a new chapter on font modification (10: Grooming the Font). This new chapter, however, is not a "how-to," but, as with the rest of the book, comprises an overview of things to consider IF you are going to make adjustments/improvements to a font.
Anybody know what the differences are between 3.0 (on my shelf) and 3.1? I'm getting no help from Amazon nor Barnes & Noble.
